Hello everyone! It's UpsilonAerospace.

~~~

As you may remember, I had a good run back in 0.90 making flying cars. As soon as 1.0 dropped, though, I thought that those days were over. Suddenly, aerodynamics were vaguely realistic! And flying cars... well, they just aren't realistic. Right?

Wrong.

Pandoras Kitten provided the first hint to me that vehicles could, indeed, fly in 1.0. Even though her (his?) recently-created beautiful VW bus couldn't take off on its own, it nonetheless showed some potential:

As a side bonus I believe the Bus is airworthy. Most of the body is built with airfoils for weight saving, and jump tests exhibited a peculiar ability to stabilise itself in mid air.

...and if an automobile that wasn't built to fly could be airworthy... well, that was certainly worth investigating.

After some time, I got a modestly successful flying car up into the air. I'm not going to post the .craft file yet (tweaks must still be made) but if you have any comments or recommendations, I'd love to hear them!

~~~

The Skymobile Mk5

Ushering in a new era of flying cars!

Images:

The Skymobile on the ground. This particular version seats two, though unless you have a mod to remove the kerbals' helmets, seating is rather cozy...

...and it's off! The Skymobile takes off at somewhere around 45 m/s. Once in the air, it can exceed 60 m/s (but it's draggy for obvious reasons, and the two "Puff" monopropellant engines don't provide the craft with enough power to reach unsafe speeds).

Flying out over the ocean. The Skymobile only has enough fuel for a two minutes or so of sustained flight, which is something I'm planning on improving in the future.

...and headed back to base post-landing. Jeb and Val had a blast flying this thing!

~~~

So that's the Skymobile so far. I'll post progress updates, whether I continue to try to iron out this thing's flaws (high CoM, low flight time) or perhaps create a new-and-improved Skymobile! This was more of a "I'm still here, and I'm still creating flying cars" announcement than anything...

Thanks for stopping by!

-Upsilon

To give you a sense of why I haven't released the .craft file yet, here are a couple of the problems this thing still has:

>Brakes aren't working after I tweaked the thing's brake torque and made it front-wheel-steering only. (I think this is a known bug, and I'm wondering how to fix it.)

>The CoM is high enough that turns at over 10 m/s or so lead to flips that I cannot recover from. I'm actually currently trying to lower everything that has significant mass.

>The thing disintegrates completely when landed with a vertical velocity of more than about 5 m/s. I would like that to be a little higher.

>And, as always, it needs a little more juice to stay in the air for longer.

I'm also working on some other stuff at the moment, such as this pretty little guy and also college. So don't expect the .craft file to be out soon, unfortunately...
